comments.body: How advanced would we need the downloaded CSV to be? Should we be able to filter the results, then download the file? Or is it just one file that will be downloadable with all requests? @kevinreiss

Here is a quick way to generate a downloadable CSV file (via VSCode): spec > features > download_csv_script.rb

Here are some examples of the generated data: 

```
creator,status,start_date,end_date,notes,request_type
"Mraz, Shanda (uid18692)",denied,2022-11-04,2022-11-05,#<Note::ActiveRecord_Associations_CollectionProxy:0x00007fe750268740>,AbsenceRequest
"Williamson, Felicita (uid395)",denied,2023-05-29,2023-06-01,#<Note::ActiveRecord_Associations_CollectionProxy:0x00007fe74d6b8460>,TravelRequest
"Williamson, Felicita (uid395)",denied,2023-10-23,2023-10-26,#<Note::ActiveRecord_Associations_CollectionProxy:0x00007fe74d6b1fe8>,TravelRequest
```

comments.body:
We accessed a database backup from earlier in the week. We sshed directly to the storage machine, rather than running grep over the mount, because the file was 120G. 

`LC_ALL=C grep -A 2000 roles_users [name of file]`

(It wasn't roles_users in the end, it was a bit more of a string to make sure we got just the table)

Once we had the list of IDs, we put them into an array and ran the following in the rails console:

```ruby
admin_role = Role.find_or_create_by(name: "admin")

admin_users.each do |user_id|
  u = User.find(user_id)
  next if u.roles.include? admin_role
  puts "Making #{u} an admin"
  u.roles << admin_role
  u.save
end

```

orangelight.title: In the Available Online section update the display link for finding aids records

comments.body:
@LynnDurgin @slogue 
Could you say a little more about why you feel that these issues should be handled on the display layer rather than in the data? I'd just like to understand better what you're trying to accomplish by keeping different display values in Alma from what we actually want to display.

My inclination would be to handle both on the data layer, but perhaps I'm missing something? Here's what I would suggest:

> 'arkLink' -- change to --> 'Princeton University Library Finding Aids' (this will be the title for the link)

The MARC coding for the link text is $y, which isn't present in the data right now. So we could
1. update the aspace2alma process to include it
2. create a set to update any records in Alma not updated by the aspace2alma process
3. create and run a job over that set
4. it looks like $y is already indexed and displays (but I haven't double-checked): https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/main/marc_to_solr/lib/traject_config.rb#L378

> 'Finding aid online' --change to --> 'Search and request'

Orangelight pulls the display from the value in 856$z. Since that field is geared at patrons, changing it shouldn't affect staff, or does it? We could
1. update the aspace2alma process
2. create a set to update any records in Alma not updated by the aspace2alma process
3. create and run a job over that set

princeton_ansible.title: Common can not run apt get update because a package fails

comments.body: Closed by #3206 and #3024. We now run `apt-get update` from the OS update playbook during maintenance windows. The datadog role still has some `cache_update: true` things set, but otherwise I think we have removed them. Planning to set the OS update playbook to run on a schedule in Tower.
@kayiwa looks like something went slightly off with your rebase.  This PR should not include Remove molecule mariadb role as that is already a part of main.

princeton_ansible.title: Remove 'update_cache: true' from roles unless explicit and useful

comments.body:
Failure is coming from the `common` role:
```
TASK [common : common | install building software and build essentials] ********
  fatal: [instance]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "No package matching 'htop' is available"}
```
Update: we do need to run `apt-get update` in testing, because the cache on our test image is stale. Adding this functionality as a pre-task in the `molecule/default/converge.yml` files. See #3365.

Next failure is from the tests for the Drupal9 role, but it's an error in a handler marked `php`:
```
RUNNING HANDLER [php : restart apache] *****************************************
  fatal: [instance]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "Output of config test was:\nenv: ‘apache2ctl’: No such file or directory\n"}
```
Update: this was caused by the PHP role installing nginx but then restarting apache2. Fixed by #3367.

comments.body: @eliotjordan why do we update this way instead of pulling commits directly?

@hackartisan We have customized the gem enough and were far behind the upstream enough that syncing was messy (rubocop being the primary cause). The better thing to do here is probably to submit a PR to the upstream gem to allow passing in a config file path.
@hackartisan I made an upstream PR: https://github.com/mrcsparker/ruby_tika_app/pull/17
Awesome!!
